title: PIXEL 2 XL is melting usb-c cable, google support for repair request is practically useless
content:
hi,

my pixel 2 xl suddenly burn every usb-c cable that I plugged into the phone whenever i tried to charge or connect it to computer, the usb-c connector become very hot and a burnt smell come out from it, when i plugged it out a black burnt mark is visible inside the usb-c cable jack.

So far, it has burnt 3 cable including the original cable that come from the box.

I tried to contact google via the website but always be turned around into useless FAQS, and the support center options which are "request a call" can not be submitted as it is ALWAYS not business hours, I can't even seems to find when is this "business hours" are.

the chat options is not even available.

So now i stuck with a dead device, no way to charge, no way to contact support.

does anyone have the same experience as me? can you please tell me how to get support for my device, it is still under warranty until May 2020, but the way that the situation goes i think i better of using it as a door stop.
